ONLINE VERSIONONLINE VERSION Requirement S1 and regulation 44D: Electric vehicle charging provisions for new residential buildings
The erection of new residential buildings
The number of associated parking spaces which have access to electric vehicle charge points must be—
Cable routes for electric vehicle charge points must be installed in any associated parking spaces which do not, in accordance with paragraph (2), have an electric vehicle charge point where—
Building Regulations 2010 Approved Document S, 2021 edition 3
Application of paragraph S1 of Schedule 1 (the erection of new residential buildings)
Where the new residential building has, or will have, associated parking that is situated within a covered car park—
if there are or will be any associated parking spaces situated in a position other than in a covered car park—
the requirements of paragraph S1 of Schedule 1 must first be applied in relation to those parking spaces; then

if the number of associated parking spaces, which are situated in a position other than in a covered car park, is insufficient to completely fulfil the requirements of paragraph S1(2) of Schedule 1, cable routes for electric vehicle charge points must be installed in—
if all the associated parking spaces are situated in a covered car park, cable routes for electric vehicle charge points must be installed—
where there are 10 or fewer parking spaces—
Where the building control body is an approved inspector, see regulation 8 of the Building (Approved Inspectors etc.)
Approved Document S, 2021 edition Building Regulations 2010

the average connection cost for an electric vehicle charge point connection is greater than £3600
some of the associated parking spaces associated with the new residential building are within a covered car park

more than the number of dwellings

VERSIONONLINE VERSION Requirement S2 and regulation 44E: Dwellings resulting from a material change of use
Dwellings resulting from a material change of use
Application of paragraph S2 of Schedule 1 (dwellings resulting from a material change of use)
The requirements of paragraph S2 of Schedule 1 apply—
the material change of use involves building work being done which includes work being done to any of the following—
Building Regulations 2010 Approved Document S, 2021 edition 9

If paragraph (2)(a) and (c) applies, but electric vehicle charge points for some but not all of the dwellings resulting from a building, or a part of a building, undergoing a material change of use can be accommodated within the incoming electrical supply to that building—
The requirements of paragraph S2 of Schedule 1 do not apply if a building, or a part of a building, is—
If the building, or a part of a building, undergoing a material change of use to result in one or more dwellings has, or will have, associated parking that is situated within a covered car park—
if there are or will be any associated parking spaces situated in a position other than in a covered car park—
the requirements of paragraph S2 of Schedule 1 must first be applied in relation to those associated parking spaces; then

if the number of associated parking spaces, which are situated in a position other than in a covered car park, is insufficient to completely fulfil the requirements of paragraph S2 of Schedule 1, cable routes for electric vehicle charge points must be installed in—
if all the associated parking spaces are situated in a covered car park, cable routes for electric vehicle charge points must be installed in—
Where the building control body is an approved inspector, see regulation 8 of the Building (Approved Inspectors etc.)
Approved Document S, 2021 edition Building Regulations 2010
Requirement S3 and regulation 44F: Residential buildings undergoing major renovation work
Where a residential building undergoing major renovation will have more than 10 associated parking spaces after the major renovation is completed—
Application of paragraph S3 of Schedule 1 (residential buildings undergoing major renovation)
The requirements of paragraph S3 of Schedule 1 apply if—
the major renovation involves building work being done which includes work being done to any of the following—
Building Regulations 2010 Approved Document S, 2021 edition 11
If paragraph (2)(a), (b), (d) and (e) applies, but all the required electric vehicle charge points cannot be accommodated within the incoming electrical supply to the building—
If the cost of installing the required electric vehicle charge points and cable routes for electric vehicle charge points exceeds 7% of the total cost of the major renovation—
If a residential building undergoing major renovation has, or will have more than 10 associated parking spaces—
if there are or will be any associated parking spaces situated in a position other than in a covered car park—
the requirements of paragraph S3 of Schedule 1 must first be applied in relation to those associated parking spaces; then
Where the building control body is an approved inspector, see regulation 8 of the Building (Approved Inspectors etc.)
Approved Document S, 2021 edition Building Regulations 2010

S2,S3ONLINE VERSIONONLINE VERSION Requirement S4 and regulation 44G: New buildings other than residential or mixed-use buildings
Where a new building which is not a residential building or a mixed-use building has more than 10 parking spaces—
Application of paragraph S4 of Schedule 1 (erection of new buildings which are not residential buildings or mixed-use buildings)
If such a new building has, or will have, within its site boundary, more than 10 parking spaces—
if there are or will be any parking spaces situated in a position other than in a covered car park—
the requirements of paragraph S4 of Schedule 1 must first be applied in relation to those parking spaces; then
Where the building control body is an approved inspector, see regulation 8 of the Building (Approved Inspectors etc.)

S4ONLINE VERSIONONLINE VERSION Requirement S5 and regulation 44H: Buildings other than residential buildings undergoing major renovation work
Buildings undergoing major renovation which are not residential buildings or mixed-use buildings
Where a building undergoing major renovation, which is not a residential building or a mixed-use building, will have more than 10 parking spaces after the major renovation is completed—
Application of paragraph S5 of Schedule 1 (buildings undergoing major renovation which are not residential buildings or mixed-use buildings)
The requirements of paragraph S5 of Schedule 1 apply to such a building if—
the major renovation involves building work being done which includes work being done to any of the following—
Building Regulations 2010 Approved Document S, 2021 edition 19
If the cost of installing the required electric vehicle charge point and cable routes for electric vehicle charge points exceeds 7% of the total cost of the major renovation—
If such a building has, or will have, within its site boundary, more than 10 parking spaces—
if there are or will be any parking spaces situated in a position other than in a covered car park—
the requirements of paragraph S5 of Schedule 1 must first be applied in relation to those parking spaces; then
Where the building control body is an approved inspector, see regulation 8 of the Building (Approved Inspectors etc.)

VERSIONONLINE VERSION Requirement S6 and regulation 44I: Mixed-use buildings
The erection of new mixed-use buildings and mixed-use buildings undergoing major renovation
Application of paragraph S6 of Schedule 1 (the erection of new mixed-use buildings and mixed-use buildings undergoing major renovation)
If such a mixed-use building has, or will have, within its site boundary, a covered car park—
if there are or will be any parking spaces situated in a position other than in a covered car park—
the requirements of paragraph S6 of Schedule 1 must first be applied in relation to those parking spaces; then

if the number of parking spaces, which are situated in a position other than in a covered car park, is insufficient to completely fulfil the requirements of paragraph S6 of Schedule 1, cable routes for electric vehicle charge points must be installed in accordance with—
Building Regulations 2010 Approved Document S, 2021 edition 23
if all the parking spaces are situated in a covered car park, cable routes for electric vehicle charge points must be installed in accordance with—
Where the building control body is an approved inspector, see regulation 8 of the Building (Approved Inspectors etc.)
Approved Document S, 2021 edition Building Regulations 2010
Application of Part S for mixed-use buildings
For example, if a new building is constructed which has retail space on the ground floor and dwellings on the floors above, then the requirements would apply as follows
